forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind around 12 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Veterans Day
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 4pm, then a slight chance of drizzle. Partly sunny. High near 60, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 12 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dawn breaks over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle rain persists, illuminating the narrow streets with a soft, silken sheen. The clouds cling to the skyline, draping the city in a muted grey as the winds whisper around 12 mph, suggesting a briskness that settles into the bones. With temperatures lingering near 54 degrees, this morning invites an embrace of warmth—perhaps a cozy sweater paired with a waterproof jacket would best suit the day ahead. 

As we venture into Veterans Day, the rain will hold its ground until late afternoon, spilling gently from the heavens, before giving way to sporadic drizzle and perhaps even glimpses of blue skies battling for attention. A high of approximately 60 promises to bring a slight increase in warmth but expect a noticeable drop as the afternoon wanes into evening. The marine layer, heavy and determined, will likely hang low, obscuring the iconic views often celebrated in sunlight. For the unrefined adventurer, this day offers a quiet charm; strolls through the neighborhood cafés may yield delightful conversations, and a visit to the local bookshop could provide the perfect refuge from the cool, damp air. Today navigates the delicate balance between the comfort of home and the pull of the world outside, cloaked in the soft embrace of a rainy San Francisco day.
